On 7/9/14, 12:36 PM, "Erik Wilde" <dret@...> wrote:


>then how wo=
uld a race condition enter the picture? just because of the
>timestamp when=
 you last observed the resource's state? or something
>else? to me, togglin=
g always is kind of a game: if somebody toggled
>ahead of you, you'll do so=
mething other than you wanted to, but that's
>how it is and you'll have to =
deal with it after toggling and finding out
>that you switched the damn thi=
ng back on again...

It doesn't.  Apologies for being confusing - I was thi=
nking about the race
condition if I were limited to a GET followed by a PUT=
.  However, the POST
mechanism solves this by being atomic.

Thanks again,
=
Robby
